Question #history_1237_87ca0aad-2581-4d09-80a4-e383f6edf1e7
After the War of Independence and truce called in July 1921, representatives of the British government and the Irish treaty delegates, led by Arthur Griffith, Robert Barton and Michael Collins, negoti...
Clean
Full Question
After the War of Independence and truce called in July 1921, representatives of the British government and the Irish treaty delegates, led by Arthur Griffith, Robert Barton and Michael Collins, negotiated the Anglo-Irish Treaty in London from 11 October to 6 December 1921. The Irish delegates set up headquarters at Hans Place in Knightsbridge, and it was here in private discussions that the decision was taken on 5 December to recommend the treaty to D√°il √âireann.The Second D√°il √âireann narrowly ratified the Treaty. In accordance with the treaty, on 6 December 1922 the entire island of Ireland became a self-governing Dominion called the Irish Free State . Under the Constitution of the Irish Free State, the Parliament of Northern Ireland had the option to leave the Irish Free State one month later and return to the United Kingdom. During the intervening period, the powers of the Parliament of the Irish Free State and Executive Council of the Irish Free State did not extend to Northern Ireland. Northern Ireland exercised its right under the treaty to leave the new Dominion and rejoined the United Kingdom on 8 December 1922. It did so by making an address to the King requesting, "that the powers of the Parliament and Government of the Irish Free State shall no longer extend to Northern Ireland." The Irish Free State was a constitutional monarchy sharing a monarch with the United Kingdom and other Dominions of the British Commonwealth. The country had a governor-general , a bicameral parliament, a cabinet called the "Executive Council", and a prime minister called the President of the Executive Council. How many days before the end of the negotiating of the Anglo-Irish Treaty was a decision taken to recommend the treaty to D√°il √âireann?
Ground Truth Answer
[['1', 2]]
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: After the War of Independence and truce called in July 1921, representatives of the British government and the Irish treaty delegates, led by Arthur Griffith, Robert Barton and Michael Collins, negotiated the Anglo-Irish Treaty in London from 11 October to 6 December 1921. The Irish delegates set up headquarters at Hans Place in Knightsbridge, and it was here in private discussions that the decision was taken on 5 December to recommend the treaty to D√°il √âireann.The Second D√°il √âireann narrowly ratified the Treaty. In accordance with the treaty, on 6 December 1922 the entire island of Ireland became a self-governing Dominion called the Irish Free State . Under the Constitution of the Irish Free State, the Parliament of Northern Ireland had the option to leave the Irish Free State one month later and return to the United Kingdom. During the intervening period, the powers of the Parliament of the Irish Free State and Executive Council of the Irish Free State did not extend to Northern Ireland. Northern Ireland exercised its right under the treaty to leave the new Dominion and rejoined the United Kingdom on 8 December 1922. It did so by making an address to the King requesting, "that the powers of the Parliament and Government of the Irish Free State shall no longer extend to Northern Ireland." The Irish Free State was a constitutional monarchy sharing a monarch with the United Kingdom and other Dominions of the British Commonwealth. The country had a governor-general , a bicameral parliament, a cabinet called the "Executive Council", and a prime minister called the President of the Executive Council. How many days before the end of the negotiating of the Anglo-Irish Treaty was a decision taken to recommend the treaty to D√°il √âireann? Answer: The passage states that the Anglo-Irish Treaty negotiations ended on December 6, 1921. The decision to recommend the treaty was made on December 5, 1921. December 6 - December 5 = 1 day. So the answer is $\boxed{1}$.
Overall Quality: excellent
The reasoning chain correctly identifies the relevant dates from the text and performs the correct subtraction to answer the question.

‚úì No hallucinations detected

Question #history_1237_daec607e-3554-4ebc-913e-2eac19c82338
After the War of Independence and truce called in July 1921, representatives of the British government and the Irish treaty delegates, led by Arthur Griffith, Robert Barton and Michael Collins, negoti...
1 issue
Full Question
After the War of Independence and truce called in July 1921, representatives of the British government and the Irish treaty delegates, led by Arthur Griffith, Robert Barton and Michael Collins, negotiated the Anglo-Irish Treaty in London from 11 October to 6 December 1921. The Irish delegates set up headquarters at Hans Place in Knightsbridge, and it was here in private discussions that the decision was taken on 5 December to recommend the treaty to D√°il √âireann.The Second D√°il √âireann narrowly ratified the Treaty. In accordance with the treaty, on 6 December 1922 the entire island of Ireland became a self-governing Dominion called the Irish Free State . Under the Constitution of the Irish Free State, the Parliament of Northern Ireland had the option to leave the Irish Free State one month later and return to the United Kingdom. During the intervening period, the powers of the Parliament of the Irish Free State and Executive Council of the Irish Free State did not extend to Northern Ireland. Northern Ireland exercised its right under the treaty to leave the new Dominion and rejoined the United Kingdom on 8 December 1922. It did so by making an address to the King requesting, "that the powers of the Parliament and Government of the Irish Free State shall no longer extend to Northern Ireland." The Irish Free State was a constitutional monarchy sharing a monarch with the United Kingdom and other Dominions of the British Commonwealth. The country had a governor-general , a bicameral parliament, a cabinet called the "Executive Council", and a prime minister called the President of the Executive Council. How many months after the truce of the War of Independence was called did the entire island of Ireland become the Irish Free State?
Ground Truth Answer
[['17', 2]]
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: After the War of Independence and truce called in July 1921, representatives of the British government and the Irish treaty delegates, led by Arthur Griffith, Robert Barton and Michael Collins, negotiated the Anglo-Irish Treaty in London from 11 October to 6 December 1921. The Irish delegates set up headquarters at Hans Place in Knightsbridge, and it was here in private discussions that the decision was taken on 5 December to recommend the treaty to D√°il √âireann.The Second D√°il √âireann narrowly ratified the Treaty. In accordance with the treaty, on 6 December 1922 the entire island of Ireland became a self-governing Dominion called the Irish Free State. Under the Constitution of the Irish Free State, the Parliament of Northern Ireland had the option to leave the Irish Free State one month later and return to the United Kingdom. During the intervening period, the powers of the Parliament of the Irish Free State and Executive Council of the Irish Free State did not extend to Northern Ireland. Northern Ireland exercised its right under the treaty to leave the new Dominion and rejoined the United Kingdom on 8 December 1922. It did so by making an address to the King requesting, "that the powers of the Parliament and Government of the Irish Free State shall no longer extend to Northern Ireland." The Irish Free State was a constitutional monarchy sharing a monarch with the United Kingdom and other Dominions of the British Commonwealth. The country had a governor-general , a bicameral parliament, a cabinet called the "Executive Council", and a prime minister called the President of the Executive Council. How many months after the truce of the War of Independence was called did the entire island of Ireland become the Irish Free State? Answer: The truce was called in July 1921. Ireland became the Irish Free State on December 6, 1922. From July 1921 to December 1922, there are 17 months (5 months in 1921 (August to December) + 12 months in 1922). Therefore, the answer is $\boxed{17}$.
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning chain correctly identifies the start date (July 1921) and end date (December 6, 1922) from the context. However, the subsequent calculation to determine the number of months between these two points is mathematically flawed and contradicts the actual duration implied by the dates provided in the context, leading to an incorrect final answer based on faulty arithmetic.

Detected Issues (1)

contradiction medium
Statement
From July 1921 to December 1922, there are 17 months (5 months in 1921 (August to December) + 12 months in 1922).
Explanation
The calculation incorrectly counts the months. If the truce was called in July 1921, the period until December 1922 is 17 months (July 1921 to July 1922 is 12 months, plus August, September, October, November, December 1922 = 5 months). The reasoning states 5 months in 1921 (August to December), which is 5 months, but the total period from July 1921 to December 1922 inclusive is 18 months if counting the start month, or 17 months if counting the difference between the start of July 1921 and the start of December 1922. However, the calculation provided (5 months in 1921 + 12 months in 1922 = 17 months) is mathematically flawed for the period described. July 1921 to December 1921 is 6 months (July, Aug, Sep, Oct, Nov, Dec). July 1921 to December 1922 is 18 months total (6 months in 1921 + 12 months in 1922). The reasoning states 5 months in 1921 (August to December), which ignores July 1921, leading to an incorrect count of 17 months.
Answer Span:
From July 1921 to December 1922, there are 17 months (5 months in 1921 (August to December) + 12 months in 1922)

Question #history_175_17f59db4-794b-4cc4-9036-b6f0ccd9789c
When Matthias Corvinus died from a stroke on 6 April 1490, Frederick was able to regain the Austrian lands. However, he could not enforce the Habsburg succession to the Hungarian throne and in 1491 hi...
Clean
Full Question
When Matthias Corvinus died from a stroke on 6 April 1490, Frederick was able to regain the Austrian lands. However, he could not enforce the Habsburg succession to the Hungarian throne and in 1491 his son King Maximilian I signed the Peace of Pressburg with Vladislaus Jagiellon, who was elected Matthias' successor in Hungary. The treaty arranged for the return of Matthias' conquests, and the agreement that Maximilian would succeed Vladislaus should he produce no heir. This did not happen as Vladislaus' son Louis II was born in 1506, but the Habsburgs did exert significant pressure on the Jagiellonians with the 1515 First Congress of Vienna in which they arranged two royal weddings of Vladislaus' daughter Anne with Maximilian's grandson Ferdinand and of Maximilian's granddaughter Mary with Louis II. The double wedding celebrated at St. Stephen's Cathedral decisively advanced the Habsburg succession agenda. During his reign in Hungary, the new Polish king would go on to undo many of Matthias' efforts, unmaking the reformed system of taxation, the standing army, and the centralized authority of the monarch. Hungary's nobles would act in complicity with this, contributing to the weakening of the country until 1526, when Hungary was defeated by the Ottoman Empire in the Battle of Moh√°cs, whereby King Louis II was killed. The Habsburg archduke Ferdinand of Austria by his marriage with Anne of Bohemia and Hungary claimed the succession, he was enfoffed with the Bohemian kingdom by his elder brother Emperor Charles V and also reached the consent of the Hungarian magnates. He was crowned king in Pressburg on 24 February 1527, laying the grounds for the transnational Habsburg Monarchy. How many years old was Louis II when he died?
Ground Truth Answer
[['20', 2]]
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: When Matthias Corvinus died from a stroke on 6 April 1490, Frederick was able to regain the Austrian lands. However, he could not enforce the Habsburg succession to the Hungarian throne and in 1491 his son King Maximilian I signed the Peace of Pressburg with Vladislaus Jagiellon, who was elected Matthias' successor in Hungary. The treaty arranged for the return of Matthias' conquests, and the agreement that Maximilian would succeed Vladislaus should he produce no heir. This did not happen as Vladislaus' son Louis II was born in 1506, but the Habsburgs did exert significant pressure on the Jagiellonians with the 1515 First Congress of Vienna in which they arranged two royal weddings of Vladislaus' daughter Anne with Maximilian's grandson Ferdinand and of Maximilian's granddaughter Mary with Louis II. The double wedding celebrated at St. Stephen's Cathedral decisively advanced the Habsburg succession agenda. During his reign in Hungary, the new Polish king would go on to undo many of Matthias' efforts, unmaking the reformed system of taxation, the standing army, and the centralized authority of the monarch. Hungary's nobles would act in complicity with this, contributing to the weakening of the country until 1526, when Hungary was defeated by the Ottoman Empire in the Battle of Moh√°cs, whereby King Louis II was killed. The Habsburg archduke Ferdinand of Austria by his marriage with Anne of Bohemia and Hungary claimed the succession, he was enfoffed with the Bohemian kingdom by his elder brother Emperor Charles V and also reached the consent of the Hungarian magnates. He was crowned king in Pressburg on 24 February 1527, laying the grounds for the transnational Habsburg Monarchy. How many years old was Louis II when he died? Answer: Louis II was born in 1506. He died in 1526. 1526 - 1506 = 20. So the answer is $\boxed{20}$.
Overall Quality: excellent
The reasoning chain correctly extracts the birth year (1506) and death year (1526) of Louis II from the context and performs the correct subtraction to find his age at death.

‚úì No hallucinations detected

Question #history_1237_85ef7d66-ce05-44db-9405-08cf211f95cf
After the War of Independence and truce called in July 1921, representatives of the British government and the Irish treaty delegates, led by Arthur Griffith, Robert Barton and Michael Collins, negoti...
1 issue
Full Question
After the War of Independence and truce called in July 1921, representatives of the British government and the Irish treaty delegates, led by Arthur Griffith, Robert Barton and Michael Collins, negotiated the Anglo-Irish Treaty in London from 11 October to 6 December 1921. The Irish delegates set up headquarters at Hans Place in Knightsbridge, and it was here in private discussions that the decision was taken on 5 December to recommend the treaty to D√°il √âireann.The Second D√°il √âireann narrowly ratified the Treaty. In accordance with the treaty, on 6 December 1922 the entire island of Ireland became a self-governing Dominion called the Irish Free State . Under the Constitution of the Irish Free State, the Parliament of Northern Ireland had the option to leave the Irish Free State one month later and return to the United Kingdom. During the intervening period, the powers of the Parliament of the Irish Free State and Executive Council of the Irish Free State did not extend to Northern Ireland. Northern Ireland exercised its right under the treaty to leave the new Dominion and rejoined the United Kingdom on 8 December 1922. It did so by making an address to the King requesting, "that the powers of the Parliament and Government of the Irish Free State shall no longer extend to Northern Ireland." The Irish Free State was a constitutional monarchy sharing a monarch with the United Kingdom and other Dominions of the British Commonwealth. The country had a governor-general , a bicameral parliament, a cabinet called the "Executive Council", and a prime minister called the President of the Executive Council. How many days after the negotiating of the Anglo-Irish Treaty did the entire island of Ireland become the Irish Free State?
Ground Truth Answer
[['365', 2]]
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: After the War of Independence and truce called in July 1921, representatives of the British government and the Irish treaty delegates, led by Arthur Griffith, Robert Barton and Michael Collins, negotiated the Anglo-Irish Treaty in London from 11 October to 6 December 1921. The Irish delegates set up headquarters at Hans Place in Knightsbridge, and it was here in private discussions that the decision was taken on 5 December to recommend the treaty to D√°il √âireann.The Second D√°il √âireann narrowly ratified the Treaty. In accordance with the treaty, on 6 December 1922 the entire island of Ireland became a self-governing Dominion called the Irish Free State. Under the Constitution of the Irish Free State, the Parliament of Northern Ireland had the option to leave the Irish Free State one month later and return to the United Kingdom. During the intervening period, the powers of the Parliament of the Irish Free State and Executive Council of the Irish Free State did not extend to Northern Ireland. Northern Ireland exercised its right under the treaty to leave the new Dominion and rejoined the United Kingdom on 8 December 1922. It did so by making an address to the King requesting, "that the powers of the Parliament and Government of the Irish Free State shall no longer extend to Northern Ireland." The Irish Free State was a constitutional monarchy sharing a monarch with the United Kingdom and other Dominions of the British Commonwealth. The country had a governor-general , a bicameral parliament, a cabinet called the "Executive Council", and a prime minister called the President of the Executive Council. How many days after the negotiating of the Anglo-Irish Treaty did the entire island of Ireland become the Irish Free State? Answer: The passage states that the Anglo-Irish Treaty was negotiated from October 11, 1921 to December 6, 1921. The passage also states that the entire island of Ireland became the Irish Free State on December 6, 1922. From December 6, 1921 to December 6, 1922 is one year, which is 365 days. So the answer is $\boxed{365}$.
Overall Quality: good
The reasoning chain correctly identifies the two necessary dates from the text (end of negotiation: Dec 6, 1921; establishment of Free State: Dec 6, 1922) and calculates the difference as 365 days. This calculation is an inference based on the extracted facts and does not contradict any explicit statement in the source text.

Explanation

Question #nfl_1838_2f70aca0-fbe1-43e1-8f0e-a448c3326430
Following their Monday Night debacle in San Diego and subsequent videotaping scandal, the Broncos returned home for an interconference match against the St. Louis Rams. In the first quarter, the Bron...
Clean
Full Question
Following their Monday Night debacle in San Diego and subsequent videotaping scandal, the Broncos returned home for an interconference match against the St. Louis Rams. In the first quarter, the Broncos jumped out to a 10-0 lead, with a 4-yard touchdown run from running back Knowshon Moreno, followed by a 49-yard field goal by placekicker Matt Prater. The Rams responded, with quarterback Sam Bradford throwing a 36-yard touchdown pass to tight end Michael Hoomanawanui. In the second quarter, The Broncos took a 13-7 lead, with a 40-yard field goal by Prater. However, the Rams would reel off 26 unanswered points, starting off with a pair of touchdown passes from Bradford to tight end Billy Bajema—2 and 26 yards—the latter with a missed extra point, followed by a pair of field goals from placekicker Josh Brown—28 and 37 yards—before halftime. In the third quarter, the Rams continued their offensive onslaught, with a 1-yard touchdown run from running back Kenneth Darby, giving St. Louis a 33-13 lead. In the fourth quarter, the Broncos snapped the Rams' streak of 26 unanswered points, with quarterback Kyle Orton throwing a 41-yard touchdown pass to wide receiver Brandon Lloyd, but the Rams responded with a 26-yard field goal from Brown. Trailing 36-20 with four minutes remaining, the Broncos tried to rally, with Orton throwing two touchdown passes—a 16-yarder to wide receiver Eddie Royal (with a failed two-point conversion attempt), followed by a 5-yarder to Lloyd, but the Broncos' rally attempt was cut short by the Rams' defense. With the loss, the Broncos matched their loss total from the previous two seasons. How many yards difference was Matt Prater‚Äôs first field goal compared to his second?
Ground Truth Answer
[['9', 2]]
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: Following their Monday Night debacle in San Diego and subsequent videotaping scandal, the Broncos returned home for an interconference match against the St. Louis Rams. In the first quarter, the Broncos jumped out to a 10-0 lead, with a 4-yard touchdown run from running back Knowshon Moreno, followed by a 49-yard field goal by placekicker Matt Prater. The Rams responded, with quarterback Sam Bradford throwing a 36-yard touchdown pass to tight end Michael Hoomanawanui. In the second quarter, The Broncos took a 13-7 lead, with a 40-yard field goal by Prater. However, the Rams would reel off 26 unanswered points, starting off with a pair of touchdown passes from Bradford to tight end Billy Bajema—2 and 26 yards—the latter with a missed extra point, followed by a pair of field goals from placekicker Josh Brown—28 and 37 yards—before halftime. In the third quarter, the Rams continued their offensive onslaught, with a 1-yard touchdown run from running back Kenneth Darby, giving St. Louis a 33-13 lead. In the fourth quarter, the Broncos snapped the Rams' streak of 26 unanswered points, with quarterback Kyle Orton throwing a 41-yard touchdown pass to wide receiver Brandon Lloyd, but the Rams responded with a 26-yard field goal from Brown. Trailing 36-20 with four minutes remaining, the Broncos tried to rally, with Orton throwing two touchdown passes—a 16-yarder to wide receiver Eddie Royal (with a failed two-point conversion attempt), followed by a 5-yarder to Lloyd, but the Broncos' rally attempt was cut short by the Rams' defense. With the loss, the Broncos matched their loss total from the previous two seasons. How many yards difference was Matt Prater‚Äôs first field goal compared to his second? Answer: Matt Prater's first field goal was 49 yards. His second field goal was 40 yards. 49 - 40 = 9. So the answer is $\boxed{9}$.
Overall Quality: excellent
The reasoning chain correctly identifies the yardage for Matt Prater's two field goals from the text and accurately calculates the difference.

Following their Monday Night debacle in San Diego and subsequent videotaping scandal, the Broncos returned home for an interconference match against the St. Louis Rams. In the first quarter, the Broncos jumped out to a 10-0 lead, with a 4-yard touchdown run from running back Knowshon Moreno, followed by a 49-yard field goal by placekicker Matt Prater. Question #history_1782_0dec7ec5-e8eb-46fe-9756-fc132750ca60
One week later, Dallas faced the 1993 San Francisco 49ers season in the NFC Championship Game for the second year in a row in what was, at the time, the last NFL game to air on CBS. The 49ers had the...
Clean
Full Question
One week later, Dallas faced the 1993 San Francisco 49ers season in the NFC Championship Game for the second year in a row in what was, at the time, the last NFL game to air on CBS. The 49ers had the NFLs highest scoring offense with 473 points, 97 more than the runner-up Cowboys. The last time the two teams played for the NFC title, Dallas won when Aikman thwarted an attempted 49ers comeback with a touchdown drive late in the fourth quarter. But this time, the game was extremely one-sided. The Cowboys scored touchdowns on four of their five first-half possessions. By the end of the half, Dallas had a commanding 28-7 lead. Aikman completed 14 of 18 passes for 177 yards and three touchdowns with no interceptions, while also rushing for 25 yards, but was knocked out of the game with a concussion in the third quarter. Then San Francisco scored a touchdown, making the score 28-14 with plenty of time left for a comeback. However, their hopes were soon dashed as backup quarterback Bernie Kosar, who had already played in three conference championship games and was unable to advance to the Super Bowl each time, led the Cowboys 82 yards to go up 35-14 on his 42-yard touchdown pass to Alvin Harper. Murray then put the finishing touches on San Francisco with a 50-yard field goal, while all the 49ers could do was score a useless touchdown in "garbage time" to make the final score 38-21. Smith rushed for 88 yards, caught seven passes for 85 yards, and scored two touchdowns. Meanwhile, the Dallas defense held 49ers running back Ricky Watters, who rushed for over 100 yards and scored 5 touchdowns in the divisional round, to just 37 yards on 12 carries. How many points were the Cowboys winning by at the end of the half?
Ground Truth Answer
[['19', 1], ['21', 1]]
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: One week later, Dallas faced the 1993 San Francisco 49ers season in the NFC Championship Game for the second year in a row in what was, at the time, the last NFL game to air on CBS. The 49ers had the NFLs highest scoring offense with 473 points, 97 more than the runner-up Cowboys. The last time the two teams played for the NFC title, Dallas won when Aikman thwarted an attempted 49ers comeback with a touchdown drive late in the fourth quarter. But this time, the game was extremely one-sided. The Cowboys scored touchdowns on four of their five first-half possessions. By the end of the half, Dallas had a commanding 28-7 lead. Aikman completed 14 of 18 passes for 177 yards and three touchdowns with no interceptions, while also rushing for 25 yards, but was knocked out of the game with a concussion in the third quarter. Then San Francisco scored a touchdown, making the score 28-14 with plenty of time left for a comeback. However, their hopes were soon dashed as backup quarterback Bernie Kosar, who had already played in three conference championship games and was unable to advance to the Super Bowl each time, led the Cowboys 82 yards to go up 35-14 on his 42-yard touchdown pass to Alvin Harper. Murray then put the finishing touches on San Francisco with a 50-yard field goal, while all the 49ers could do was score a useless touchdown in "garbage time" to make the final score 38-21. Smith rushed for 88 yards, caught seven passes for 85 yards, and scored two touchdowns. Meanwhile, the Dallas defense held 49ers running back Ricky Watters, who rushed for over 100 yards and scored 5 touchdowns in the divisional round, to just 37 yards on 12 carries. How many points were the Cowboys winning by at the end of the half? Answer: The passage states that Dallas had a 28-7 lead at the end of the half. This means they were winning by 28 - 7 = 21 points. So the answer is $\boxed{21}$.
Overall Quality: excellent
The reasoning chain correctly identifies the score at the end of the half from the text and performs the correct subtraction to answer the question.

Question #nfl_199_eb985324-7e0d-4959-9cdf-a3a302290542
On October 8, the Chiefs traveled to Glendale, Arizona for their first game in the University of Phoenix Stadium to face the Arizona Cardinals. Trent Green was still recovering from his concussion, ...
Clean
Full Question
On October 8, the Chiefs traveled to Glendale, Arizona for their first game in the University of Phoenix Stadium to face the Arizona Cardinals. Trent Green was still recovering from his concussion, and Arizona's rookie quarterback Matt Leinart made his career start. The game was broadcast on CBS 1:15pm Arizona time. The game began with Arizona's offense dominating and catching the Chiefs' defense off-guard with a 49-yard touchdown pass to Wide receiver Anquan Boldin, putting the Cardinals on the scoreboard within three minutes of the game. On the opening kickoff, Dante Hall was injured and left the game, leaving rookie Jeff Webb to return the kicks for the rest of the game, including a 56-yard punt return. Samie Parker caught a 15-yard touchdown pass, leaving the Chiefs within three points of the Cardinals (17-20). The play was officially reviewed as the referees initially thought Parker caught the ball out of bounds, but the referees decided it was caught in the endzone. Damon Huard threw Larry Johnson a 78-yard screen pass that would be stopped short of a touchdown when Antrel Rolle twisted Johnson's neck by grabbing his facemask, sending him to the turf motionless for 2 minutes. Johnson recovered and received a standing ovation. The NFL fined Rolle $12,500 for his penalty. It was the second time in the 2006 season in which Rolle had been fined for an illegal tackle. The play set up Lawrence Tynes' eventual game-winning field goal, leaving the Chiefs with the 23-20 lead. Neil Rackers set up for a kick with less than 15 seconds to play in order to send the 23-20 contest into overtime. Rackers missed the uprights by a foot with seconds left in the game. How many quarters did Dante Hall play in?
Ground Truth Answer
[['1', 2]]
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: On October 8, the Chiefs traveled to Glendale, Arizona for their first game in the University of Phoenix Stadium to face the Arizona Cardinals. Trent Green was still recovering from his concussion, and Arizona's rookie quarterback Matt Leinart made his career start. The game was broadcast on CBS 1:15pm Arizona time. The game began with Arizona's offense dominating and catching the Chiefs' defense off-guard with a 49-yard touchdown pass to Wide receiver Anquan Boldin, putting the Cardinals on the scoreboard within three minutes of the game. On the opening kickoff, Dante Hall was injured and left the game, leaving rookie Jeff Webb to return the kicks for the rest of the game, including a 56-yard punt return. Samie Parker caught a 15-yard touchdown pass, leaving the Chiefs within three points of the Cardinals (17-20). The play was officially reviewed as the referees initially thought Parker caught the ball out of bounds, but the referees decided it was caught in the endzone. Damon Huard threw Larry Johnson a 78-yard screen pass that would be stopped short of a touchdown when Antrel Rolle twisted Johnson's neck by grabbing his facemask, sending him to the turf motionless for 2 minutes. Johnson recovered and received a standing ovation. The NFL fined Rolle $12,500 for his penalty. It was the second time in the 2006 season in which Rolle had been fined for an illegal tackle. The play set up Lawrence Tynes' eventual game-winning field goal, leaving the Chiefs with the 23-20 lead. Neil Rackers set up for a kick with less than 15 seconds to play in order to send the 23-20 contest into overtime. Rackers missed the uprights by a foot with seconds left in the game. How many quarters did Dante Hall play in? Answer: The passage states that Dante Hall was injured on the opening kickoff and left the game. This means he played less than one quarter. Since a quarter is the smallest unit of playing time in football, he played zero full quarters. So the answer is $\boxed{0}$.
Overall Quality: good
The reasoning correctly identifies that Dante Hall was injured on the opening kickoff and left the game, leading to the logical conclusion that he played zero full quarters. No contradictions or missing context were found.

Question #history_1782_aec757e7-1807-4b63-b8de-2ec49edbed44
One week later, Dallas faced the 1993 San Francisco 49ers season in the NFC Championship Game for the second year in a row in what was, at the time, the last NFL game to air on CBS. The 49ers had the...
Clean
Full Question
One week later, Dallas faced the 1993 San Francisco 49ers season in the NFC Championship Game for the second year in a row in what was, at the time, the last NFL game to air on CBS. The 49ers had the NFLs highest scoring offense with 473 points, 97 more than the runner-up Cowboys. The last time the two teams played for the NFC title, Dallas won when Aikman thwarted an attempted 49ers comeback with a touchdown drive late in the fourth quarter. But this time, the game was extremely one-sided. The Cowboys scored touchdowns on four of their five first-half possessions. By the end of the half, Dallas had a commanding 28-7 lead. Aikman completed 14 of 18 passes for 177 yards and three touchdowns with no interceptions, while also rushing for 25 yards, but was knocked out of the game with a concussion in the third quarter. Then San Francisco scored a touchdown, making the score 28-14 with plenty of time left for a comeback. However, their hopes were soon dashed as backup quarterback Bernie Kosar, who had already played in three conference championship games and was unable to advance to the Super Bowl each time, led the Cowboys 82 yards to go up 35-14 on his 42-yard touchdown pass to Alvin Harper. Murray then put the finishing touches on San Francisco with a 50-yard field goal, while all the 49ers could do was score a useless touchdown in "garbage time" to make the final score 38-21. Smith rushed for 88 yards, caught seven passes for 85 yards, and scored two touchdowns. Meanwhile, the Dallas defense held 49ers running back Ricky Watters, who rushed for over 100 yards and scored 5 touchdowns in the divisional round, to just 37 yards on 12 carries. How many passes did Aikman not complete in the first half?
Ground Truth Answer
[['4', 2]]
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: One week later, Dallas faced the 1993 San Francisco 49ers season in the NFC Championship Game for the second year in a row in what was, at the time, the last NFL game to air on CBS. The 49ers had the NFLs highest scoring offense with 473 points, 97 more than the runner-up Cowboys. The last time the two teams played for the NFC title, Dallas won when Aikman thwarted an attempted 49ers comeback with a touchdown drive late in the fourth quarter. But this time, the game was extremely one-sided. The Cowboys scored touchdowns on four of their five first-half possessions. By the end of the half, Dallas had a commanding 28-7 lead. Aikman completed 14 of 18 passes for 177 yards and three touchdowns with no interceptions, while also rushing for 25 yards, but was knocked out of the game with a concussion in the third quarter. Then San Francisco scored a touchdown, making the score 28-14 with plenty of time left for a comeback. However, their hopes were soon dashed as backup quarterback Bernie Kosar, who had already played in three conference championship games and was unable to advance to the Super Bowl each time, led the Cowboys 82 yards to go up 35-14 on his 42-yard touchdown pass to Alvin Harper. Murray then put the finishing touches on San Francisco with a 50-yard field goal, while all the 49ers could do was score a useless touchdown in "garbage time" to make the final score 38-21. Smith rushed for 88 yards, caught seven passes for 85 yards, and scored two touchdowns. Meanwhile, the Dallas defense held 49ers running back Ricky Watters, who rushed for over 100 yards and scored 5 touchdowns in the divisional round, to just 37 yards on 12 carries. How many passes did Aikman not complete in the first half? Answer: The question asks how many passes Aikman did *not* complete in the first half. The passage states that Aikman completed 14 of 18 passes. This means he threw 18 passes in total. 18 (total passes) - 14 (completed passes) = 4 incomplete passes. So the answer is $\boxed{4}$.
Overall Quality: excellent
The reasoning correctly identifies the necessary information (14 completed passes out of 18 attempts) and performs the correct subtraction to find the number of incomplete passes, which directly answers the question based on the provided text.

Question #history_1450_8be3e663-e0a6-41c6-9f2b-55f9a60bc54d
The Guatemalan authorities were unaware of ongoing contacts between the colonial authorities in Yucat√°n and the Itza. In the second half of 1695 President Barrios began planning another expedition aga...
Clean
Full Question
The Guatemalan authorities were unaware of ongoing contacts between the colonial authorities in Yucat√°n and the Itza. In the second half of 1695 President Barrios began planning another expedition against the Itza from Verapaz, following harsh criticism of Juan D√≠az de Velasco's retreat from near Lake Pet√©n Itz√° in April of that year. Barrios died in November, and oidor Jos√© de Escals became acting head of the Guatemalan colonial administration. He appointed oidor Bartolom√© de Am√©squeta to lead the next expedition against the Itza. Am√©squeta marched his men through torrential rain from Cahab√≥n to Mop√°n, arriving on 25 February 1696; the Guatemalans were still unaware of the clashes between Garc√≠a's forces and the Itza. Am√©squeta's expedition was suffering from shortages of native labour and supplies. Twenty-five of his 150 men were sick, and his advance stalled as the force rested up at Mop√°n. Captain D√≠az de Velasco volunteered to lead a party of 25 men ahead to the lake; he was accompanied by Dominican friars Crist√≥bal de Prada and Jacinto de Vargas. He was also accompanied by AjK'ixaw, the Itza nobleman who had been taken prisoner on D√≠az's previous expedition, who served as a trusted guide, scout and translator. They set out from Mop√°n on 7 March and left some sick soldiers with some supplies after five days, they then caught up with an advance party of roadbuilders and their military escort at R√≠o Chakal. The two forces combined, giving D√≠az a force of 49 soldiers and 34 porters and archers from Verapaz. Once they arrived at IxB'ol, near the shore of Lake Pet√©n Itz√°, AjK'ixaw was sent ahead as an emissary to Nojpet√©n. How many men of the twenty-five of his 150 men that were sick are still healthy?
Ground Truth Answer
[['125', 1]]
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: The Guatemalan authorities were unaware of ongoing contacts between the colonial authorities in Yucat√°n and the Itza. In the second half of 1695 President Barrios began planning another expedition against the Itza from Verapaz, following harsh criticism of Juan D√≠az de Velasco's retreat from near Lake Pet√©n Itz√° in April of that year. Barrios died in November, and oidor Jos√© de Escals became acting head of the Guatemalan colonial administration. He appointed oidor Bartolom√© de Am√©squeta to lead the next expedition against the Itza. Am√©squeta marched his 150 men through torrential rain from Cahab√≥n to Mop√°n, arriving on 25 February 1696; the Guatemalans were still unaware of the clashes between Garc√≠a's forces and the Itza. Am√©squeta's expedition was suffering from shortages of native labour and supplies. Twenty-five of his 150 men were sick, and his advance stalled as the force rested up at Mop√°n. Captain D√≠az de Velasco volunteered to lead a party of 25 men ahead to the lake; he was accompanied by Dominican friars Crist√≥bal de Prada and Jacinto de Vargas. He was also accompanied by AjK'ixaw, the Itza nobleman who had been taken prisoner on D√≠az's previous expedition, who served as a trusted guide, scout and translator. They set out from Mop√°n on 7 March and left some sick soldiers with some supplies after five days, they then caught up with an advance party of roadbuilders and their military escort at R√≠o Chakal. The two forces combined, giving D√≠az a force of 49 soldiers and 34 porters and archers from Verapaz. Once they arrived at IxB'ol, near the shore of Lake Pet√©n Itz√°, AjK'ixaw was sent ahead as an emissary to Nojpet√©n. How many men of the twenty-five of his 150 men that were sick are still healthy? Answer: Am√©squeta started with 150 men. Of those 150 men, 25 were sick. To find the number of healthy men, subtract the number of sick men from the total number of men: 150 - 25 = 125. So the answer is $\boxed{125}$.
Overall Quality: excellent
The reasoning correctly identifies the total number of men (150) and the number of sick men (25) from the text and performs the correct subtraction to answer the question based solely on the provided context.

Question #history_1782_4f85554d-9421-4435-a543-97b3b0dfe55e
One week later, Dallas faced the 1993 San Francisco 49ers season in the NFC Championship Game for the second year in a row in what was, at the time, the last NFL game to air on CBS. The 49ers had the...
Clean
Full Question
One week later, Dallas faced the 1993 San Francisco 49ers season in the NFC Championship Game for the second year in a row in what was, at the time, the last NFL game to air on CBS. The 49ers had the NFLs highest scoring offense with 473 points, 97 more than the runner-up Cowboys. The last time the two teams played for the NFC title, Dallas won when Aikman thwarted an attempted 49ers comeback with a touchdown drive late in the fourth quarter. But this time, the game was extremely one-sided. The Cowboys scored touchdowns on four of their five first-half possessions. By the end of the half, Dallas had a commanding 28-7 lead. Aikman completed 14 of 18 passes for 177 yards and three touchdowns with no interceptions, while also rushing for 25 yards, but was knocked out of the game with a concussion in the third quarter. Then San Francisco scored a touchdown, making the score 28-14 with plenty of time left for a comeback. However, their hopes were soon dashed as backup quarterback Bernie Kosar, who had already played in three conference championship games and was unable to advance to the Super Bowl each time, led the Cowboys 82 yards to go up 35-14 on his 42-yard touchdown pass to Alvin Harper. Murray then put the finishing touches on San Francisco with a 50-yard field goal, while all the 49ers could do was score a useless touchdown in "garbage time" to make the final score 38-21. Smith rushed for 88 yards, caught seven passes for 85 yards, and scored two touchdowns. Meanwhile, the Dallas defense held 49ers running back Ricky Watters, who rushed for over 100 yards and scored 5 touchdowns in the divisional round, to just 37 yards on 12 carries. How many points were scored at the end of the game?
Ground Truth Answer
[['59', 2]]
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: One week later, Dallas faced the 1993 San Francisco 49ers season in the NFC Championship Game for the second year in a row in what was, at the time, the last NFL game to air on CBS. The 49ers had the NFLs highest scoring offense with 473 points, 97 more than the runner-up Cowboys. The last time the two teams played for the NFC title, Dallas won when Aikman thwarted an attempted 49ers comeback with a touchdown drive late in the fourth quarter. But this time, the game was extremely one-sided. The Cowboys scored touchdowns on four of their five first-half possessions. By the end of the half, Dallas had a commanding 28-7 lead. Aikman completed 14 of 18 passes for 177 yards and three touchdowns with no interceptions, while also rushing for 25 yards, but was knocked out of the game with a concussion in the third quarter. Then San Francisco scored a touchdown, making the score 28-14 with plenty of time left for a comeback. However, their hopes were soon dashed as backup quarterback Bernie Kosar, who had already played in three conference championship games and was unable to advance to the Super Bowl each time, led the Cowboys 82 yards to go up 35-14 on his 42-yard touchdown pass to Alvin Harper. Murray then put the finishing touches on San Francisco with a 50-yard field goal, while all the 49ers could do was score a useless touchdown in "garbage time" to make the final score 38-21. Smith rushed for 88 yards, caught seven passes for 85 yards, and scored two touchdowns. Meanwhile, the Dallas defense held 49ers running back Ricky Watters, who rushed for over 100 yards and scored 5 touchdowns in the divisional round, to just 37 yards on 12 carries. How many points were scored at the end of the game? Answer: The question asks the total points scored at the end of the game. The passage states the final score was 38-21. This means Dallas scored 38 points and San Francisco scored 21 points. Therefore, the total points scored is 38 + 21 = 59. So the answer is $\boxed{59}$.
Overall Quality: excellent
The reasoning chain correctly identifies the final score from the text and accurately calculates the total points scored, directly answering the question based on the provided context.

Question #nfl_1838_38327bd5-01a4-4342-b7e0-cb209f2b4655
Following their Monday Night debacle in San Diego and subsequent videotaping scandal, the Broncos returned home for an interconference match against the St. Louis Rams. In the first quarter, the Bron...
1 issue
Full Question
Following their Monday Night debacle in San Diego and subsequent videotaping scandal, the Broncos returned home for an interconference match against the St. Louis Rams. In the first quarter, the Broncos jumped out to a 10-0 lead, with a 4-yard touchdown run from running back Knowshon Moreno, followed by a 49-yard field goal by placekicker Matt Prater. The Rams responded, with quarterback Sam Bradford throwing a 36-yard touchdown pass to tight end Michael Hoomanawanui. In the second quarter, The Broncos took a 13-7 lead, with a 40-yard field goal by Prater. However, the Rams would reel off 26 unanswered points, starting off with a pair of touchdown passes from Bradford to tight end Billy Bajema—2 and 26 yards—the latter with a missed extra point, followed by a pair of field goals from placekicker Josh Brown—28 and 37 yards—before halftime. In the third quarter, the Rams continued their offensive onslaught, with a 1-yard touchdown run from running back Kenneth Darby, giving St. Louis a 33-13 lead. In the fourth quarter, the Broncos snapped the Rams' streak of 26 unanswered points, with quarterback Kyle Orton throwing a 41-yard touchdown pass to wide receiver Brandon Lloyd, but the Rams responded with a 26-yard field goal from Brown. Trailing 36-20 with four minutes remaining, the Broncos tried to rally, with Orton throwing two touchdown passes—a 16-yarder to wide receiver Eddie Royal (with a failed two-point conversion attempt), followed by a 5-yarder to Lloyd, but the Broncos' rally attempt was cut short by the Rams' defense. With the loss, the Broncos matched their loss total from the previous two seasons. How many scores behind were the Rams before their first points?
Ground Truth Answer
[['2', 2]]
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: Following their Monday Night debacle in San Diego and subsequent videotaping scandal, the Broncos returned home for an interconference match against the St. Louis Rams. In the first quarter, the Broncos jumped out to a 10-0 lead, with a 4-yard touchdown run from running back Knowshon Moreno, followed by a 49-yard field goal by placekicker Matt Prater. The Rams responded, with quarterback Sam Bradford throwing a 36-yard touchdown pass to tight end Michael Hoomanawanui. In the second quarter, The Broncos took a 13-7 lead, with a 40-yard field goal by Prater. However, the Rams would reel off 26 unanswered points, starting off with a pair of touchdown passes from Bradford to tight end Billy Bajema—2 and 26 yards—the latter with a missed extra point, followed by a pair of field goals from placekicker Josh Brown—28 and 37 yards—before halftime. In the third quarter, the Rams continued their offensive onslaught, with a 1-yard touchdown run from running back Kenneth Darby, giving St. Louis a 33-13 lead. In the fourth quarter, the Broncos snapped the Rams' streak of 26 unanswered points, with quarterback Kyle Orton throwing a 41-yard touchdown pass to wide receiver Brandon Lloyd, but the Rams responded with a 26-yard field goal from Brown. Trailing 36-20 with four minutes remaining, the Broncos tried to rally, with Orton throwing two touchdown passes—a 16-yarder to wide receiver Eddie Royal (with a failed two-point conversion attempt), followed by a 5-yarder to Lloyd, but the Broncos' rally attempt was cut short by the Rams' defense. With the loss, the Broncos matched their loss total from the previous two seasons. How many scores behind were the Rams before their first points? Answer: The question asks how many scores the Rams were behind before they scored their first points. The passage states that the Broncos had a 10-0 lead before the Rams first scored. This 10-0 lead consisted of a touchdown (6 points) and a field goal (3 points). Therefore, the Rams were 2 scores behind (one touchdown and one field goal) before their first points. Final Answer: The final answer is $\boxed{2}$
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning correctly identifies the score difference (10-0) but then incorrectly breaks down how that score was achieved (stating 6+3=10), leading to an incorrect calculation of the number of scores behind (2 scores) based on faulty arithmetic derived from the context's stated scores.

Detected Issues (1)

contradiction high
Statement
This 10-0 lead consisted of a touchdown (6 points) and a field goal (3 points).
Explanation
The reasoning incorrectly assumes the 10-0 lead consisted of one touchdown (6 points) and one field goal (3 points), which only totals 9 points. The context explicitly states the 10-0 lead was a 4-yard touchdown run (which implies 6 points plus a successful extra point for 7 points, or 6 points plus a failed conversion for 6 points, but the total score is 10) followed by a 49-yard field goal (3 points). The context states the 10-0 lead was achieved via a touchdown run and a field goal, but the breakdown provided in the reasoning (6+3=9) contradicts the stated score of 10-0.
Answer Span:
This 10-0 lead consisted of a touchdown (6 points) and a field goal (3 points).
Reference/Question Span:
In the first quarter, the Broncos jumped out to a 10-0 lead, with a 4-yard touchdown run from running back Knowshon Moreno, followed by a 49-yard field goal by placekicker Matt Prater.
Question #history_1450_7a2dc15d-dad5-4886-96f1-5d67686bad09

Clean
Full Question
The Guatemalan authorities were unaware of ongoing contacts between the colonial authorities in Yucat√°n and the Itza. In the second half of 1695 President Barrios began planning another expedition against the Itza from Verapaz, following harsh criticism of Juan D√≠az de Velasco's retreat from near Lake Pet√©n Itz√° in April of that year. Barrios died in November, and oidor Jos√© de Escals became acting head of the Guatemalan colonial administration. He appointed oidor Bartolom√© de Am√©squeta to lead the next expedition against the Itza. Am√©squeta marched his men through torrential rain from Cahab√≥n to Mop√°n, arriving on 25 February 1696; the Guatemalans were still unaware of the clashes between Garc√≠a's forces and the Itza. Am√©squeta's expedition was suffering from shortages of native labour and supplies. Twenty-five of his 150 men were sick, and his advance stalled as the force rested up at Mop√°n. Captain D√≠az de Velasco volunteered to lead a party of 25 men ahead to the lake; he was accompanied by Dominican friars Crist√≥bal de Prada and Jacinto de Vargas. He was also accompanied by AjK'ixaw, the Itza nobleman who had been taken prisoner on D√≠az's previous expedition, who served as a trusted guide, scout and translator. They set out from Mop√°n on 7 March and left some sick soldiers with some supplies after five days, they then caught up with an advance party of roadbuilders and their military escort at R√≠o Chakal. The two forces combined, giving D√≠az a force of 49 soldiers and 34 porters and archers from Verapaz. Once they arrived at IxB'ol, near the shore of Lake Pet√©n Itz√°, AjK'ixaw was sent ahead as an emissary to Nojpet√©n. How many fighters did Diaz have with 49 soldiers and 34 porters and archers?
Ground Truth Answer
[['83', 2]]
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: The Guatemalan authorities were unaware of ongoing contacts between the colonial authorities in Yucat√°n and the Itza. In the second half of 1695 President Barrios began planning another expedition against the Itza from Verapaz, following harsh criticism of Juan D√≠az de Velasco's retreat from near Lake Pet√©n Itz√° in April of that year. Barrios died in November, and oidor Jos√© de Escals became acting head of the Guatemalan colonial administration. He appointed oidor Bartolom√© de Am√©squeta to lead the next expedition against the Itza. Am√©squeta marched his men through torrential rain from Cahab√≥n to Mop√°n, arriving on 25 February 1696; the Guatemalans were still unaware of the clashes between Garc√≠a's forces and the Itza. Am√©squeta's expedition was suffering from shortages of native labour and supplies. Twenty-five of his 150 men were sick, and his advance stalled as the force rested up at Mop√°n. Captain D√≠az de Velasco volunteered to lead a party of 25 men ahead to the lake; he was accompanied by Dominican friars Crist√≥bal de Prada and Jacinto de Vargas. He was also accompanied by AjK'ixaw, the Itza nobleman who had been taken prisoner on D√≠az's previous expedition, who served as a trusted guide, scout and translator. They set out from Mop√°n on 7 March and left some sick soldiers with some supplies after five days, they then caught up with an advance party of roadbuilders and their military escort at R√≠o Chakal. The two forces combined, giving D√≠az a force of 49 soldiers and 34 porters and archers from Verapaz. Once they arrived at IxB'ol, near the shore of Lake Pet√©n Itz√°, AjK'ixaw was sent ahead as an emissary to Nojpet√©n. How many fighters did Diaz have with 49 soldiers and 34 porters and archers? Answer: Diaz had 49 soldiers and 34 porters and archers. The question asks for the total number of fighters. Assuming both soldiers and porters/archers are considered fighters, we add the two numbers: 49 + 34 = 83. Therefore, Diaz had 83 fighters. Final Answer: The final answer is $\boxed{83}$
Overall Quality: good
The reasoning correctly identifies the components of D√≠az's force (49 soldiers and 34 porters and archers) based on the text and performs the required addition to answer the question about the total number of fighters, assuming both groups count as fighters.

Question #nfl_1838_85b90ec6-808e-4577-9ee7-e839ecb57797
Following their Monday Night debacle in San Diego and subsequent videotaping scandal, the Broncos returned home for an interconference match against the St. Louis Rams. In the first quarter, the Bron...
Clean
Full Question
Following their Monday Night debacle in San Diego and subsequent videotaping scandal, the Broncos returned home for an interconference match against the St. Louis Rams. In the first quarter, the Broncos jumped out to a 10-0 lead, with a 4-yard touchdown run from running back Knowshon Moreno, followed by a 49-yard field goal by placekicker Matt Prater. The Rams responded, with quarterback Sam Bradford throwing a 36-yard touchdown pass to tight end Michael Hoomanawanui. In the second quarter, The Broncos took a 13-7 lead, with a 40-yard field goal by Prater. However, the Rams would reel off 26 unanswered points, starting off with a pair of touchdown passes from Bradford to tight end Billy Bajema—2 and 26 yards—the latter with a missed extra point, followed by a pair of field goals from placekicker Josh Brown—28 and 37 yards—before halftime. In the third quarter, the Rams continued their offensive onslaught, with a 1-yard touchdown run from running back Kenneth Darby, giving St. Louis a 33-13 lead. In the fourth quarter, the Broncos snapped the Rams' streak of 26 unanswered points, with quarterback Kyle Orton throwing a 41-yard touchdown pass to wide receiver Brandon Lloyd, but the Rams responded with a 26-yard field goal from Brown. Trailing 36-20 with four minutes remaining, the Broncos tried to rally, with Orton throwing two touchdown passes—a 16-yarder to wide receiver Eddie Royal (with a failed two-point conversion attempt), followed by a 5-yarder to Lloyd, but the Broncos' rally attempt was cut short by the Rams' defense. With the loss, the Broncos matched their loss total from the previous two seasons. How many more field goals did Brown kick than Prater?
Ground Truth Answer
[['1', 2]]
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: Following their Monday Night debacle in San Diego and subsequent videotaping scandal, the Broncos returned home for an interconference match against the St. Louis Rams. In the first quarter, the Broncos jumped out to a 10-0 lead, with a 4-yard touchdown run from running back Knowshon Moreno, followed by a 49-yard field goal by placekicker Matt Prater. The Rams responded, with quarterback Sam Bradford throwing a 36-yard touchdown pass to tight end Michael Hoomanawanui. In the second quarter, The Broncos took a 13-7 lead, with a 40-yard field goal by Prater. However, the Rams would reel off 26 unanswered points, starting off with a pair of touchdown passes from Bradford to tight end Billy Bajema—2 and 26 yards—the latter with a missed extra point, followed by a pair of field goals from placekicker Josh Brown—28 and 37 yards—before halftime. In the third quarter, the Rams continued their offensive onslaught, with a 1-yard touchdown run from running back Kenneth Darby, giving St. Louis a 33-13 lead. In the fourth quarter, the Broncos snapped the Rams' streak of 26 unanswered points, with quarterback Kyle Orton throwing a 41-yard touchdown pass to wide receiver Brandon Lloyd, but the Rams responded with a 26-yard field goal from Brown. Trailing 36-20 with four minutes remaining, the Broncos tried to rally, with Orton throwing two touchdown passes—a 16-yarder to wide receiver Eddie Royal (with a failed two-point conversion attempt), followed by a 5-yarder to Lloyd, but the Broncos' rally attempt was cut short by the Rams' defense. With the loss, the Broncos matched their loss total from the previous two seasons. How many more field goals did Brown kick than Prater? Answer: Prater kicked two field goals (a 49-yarder and a 40-yarder). Brown kicked three field goals (a 28-yarder, a 37-yarder, and a 26-yarder). 3 - 2 = 1. So the answer is $\boxed{1}$.
Overall Quality: excellent
The reasoning chain correctly identifies the number of field goals kicked by Prater (2) and Brown (3) based on the text and accurately calculates the difference.

‚úì No hallucinations detected

Question #history_1237_03368542-1574-4350-a827-cd0138957ebc
After the War of Independence and truce called in July 1921, representatives of the British government and the Irish treaty delegates, led by Arthur Griffith, Robert Barton and Michael Collins, negoti...
Clean
Full Question
After the War of Independence and truce called in July 1921, representatives of the British government and the Irish treaty delegates, led by Arthur Griffith, Robert Barton and Michael Collins, negotiated the Anglo-Irish Treaty in London from 11 October to 6 December 1921. The Irish delegates set up headquarters at Hans Place in Knightsbridge, and it was here in private discussions that the decision was taken on 5 December to recommend the treaty to D√°il √âireann.The Second D√°il √âireann narrowly ratified the Treaty. In accordance with the treaty, on 6 December 1922 the entire island of Ireland became a self-governing Dominion called the Irish Free State . Under the Constitution of the Irish Free State, the Parliament of Northern Ireland had the option to leave the Irish Free State one month later and return to the United Kingdom. During the intervening period, the powers of the Parliament of the Irish Free State and Executive Council of the Irish Free State did not extend to Northern Ireland. Northern Ireland exercised its right under the treaty to leave the new Dominion and rejoined the United Kingdom on 8 December 1922. It did so by making an address to the King requesting, "that the powers of the Parliament and Government of the Irish Free State shall no longer extend to Northern Ireland." The Irish Free State was a constitutional monarchy sharing a monarch with the United Kingdom and other Dominions of the British Commonwealth. The country had a governor-general , a bicameral parliament, a cabinet called the "Executive Council", and a prime minister called the President of the Executive Council. How many years after the Anglo-Irish Treaty did Northern Ireland rejoin the United Kingdom?
Ground Truth Answer
[['1', 1]]
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: After the War of Independence and truce called in July 1921, representatives of the British government and the Irish treaty delegates, led by Arthur Griffith, Robert Barton and Michael Collins, negotiated the Anglo-Irish Treaty in London from 11 October to 6 December 1921. The Irish delegates set up headquarters at Hans Place in Knightsbridge, and it was here in private discussions that the decision was taken on 5 December to recommend the treaty to D√°il √âireann.The Second D√°il √âireann narrowly ratified the Treaty. In accordance with the treaty, on 6 December 1922 the entire island of Ireland became a self-governing Dominion called the Irish Free State. Under the Constitution of the Irish Free State, the Parliament of Northern Ireland had the option to leave the Irish Free State one month later and return to the United Kingdom. During the intervening period, the powers of the Parliament of the Irish Free State and Executive Council of the Irish Free State did not extend to Northern Ireland. Northern Ireland exercised its right under the treaty to leave the new Dominion and rejoined the United Kingdom on 8 December 1922. It did so by making an address to the King requesting, "that the powers of the Parliament and Government of the Irish Free State shall no longer extend to Northern Ireland." The Irish Free State was a constitutional monarchy sharing a monarch with the United Kingdom and other Dominions of the British Commonwealth. The country had a governor-general , a bicameral parliament, a cabinet called the "Executive Council", and a prime minister called the President of the Executive Council. How many years after the Anglo-Irish Treaty did Northern Ireland rejoin the United Kingdom? Answer: The Anglo-Irish Treaty was signed on December 6, 1921. Northern Ireland rejoined the United Kingdom on December 8, 1922. 1922 - 1921 = 1. So the answer is $\boxed{1}$.
Overall Quality: good
The reasoning correctly identifies the relevant dates from the text and performs the correct subtraction to find the time difference.

‚úì No hallucinations detected

Question #history_1237_11a86d1d-2ff0-47ef-a631-4cce8706eb27
After the War of Independence and truce called in July 1921, representatives of the British government and the Irish treaty delegates, led by Arthur Griffith, Robert Barton and Michael Collins, negoti...
1 issue
Full Question
After the War of Independence and truce called in July 1921, representatives of the British government and the Irish treaty delegates, led by Arthur Griffith, Robert Barton and Michael Collins, negotiated the Anglo-Irish Treaty in London from 11 October to 6 December 1921. The Irish delegates set up headquarters at Hans Place in Knightsbridge, and it was here in private discussions that the decision was taken on 5 December to recommend the treaty to D√°il √âireann.The Second D√°il √âireann narrowly ratified the Treaty. In accordance with the treaty, on 6 December 1922 the entire island of Ireland became a self-governing Dominion called the Irish Free State . Under the Constitution of the Irish Free State, the Parliament of Northern Ireland had the option to leave the Irish Free State one month later and return to the United Kingdom. During the intervening period, the powers of the Parliament of the Irish Free State and Executive Council of the Irish Free State did not extend to Northern Ireland. Northern Ireland exercised its right under the treaty to leave the new Dominion and rejoined the United Kingdom on 8 December 1922. It did so by making an address to the King requesting, "that the powers of the Parliament and Government of the Irish Free State shall no longer extend to Northern Ireland." The Irish Free State was a constitutional monarchy sharing a monarch with the United Kingdom and other Dominions of the British Commonwealth. The country had a governor-general , a bicameral parliament, a cabinet called the "Executive Council", and a prime minister called the President of the Executive Council. Over how many months did the Irtish delegates negotiate the Anglo-Irish Treaty in London?
Ground Truth Answer
[['2', 3]]
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: After the War of Independence and truce called in July 1921, representatives of the British government and the Irish treaty delegates, led by Arthur Griffith, Robert Barton and Michael Collins, negotiated the Anglo-Irish Treaty in London from 11 October to 6 December 1921. The Irish delegates set up headquarters at Hans Place in Knightsbridge, and it was here in private discussions that the decision was taken on 5 December to recommend the treaty to D√°il √âireann.The Second D√°il √âireann narrowly ratified the Treaty. In accordance with the treaty, on 6 December 1922 the entire island of Ireland became a self-governing Dominion called the Irish Free State . Under the Constitution of the Irish Free State, the Parliament of Northern Ireland had the option to leave the Irish Free State one month later and return to the United Kingdom. During the intervening period, the powers of the Parliament of the Irish Free State and Executive Council of the Irish Free State did not extend to Northern Ireland. Northern Ireland exercised its right under the treaty to leave the new Dominion and rejoined the United Kingdom on 8 December 1922. It did so by making an address to the King requesting, "that the powers of the Parliament and Government of the Irish Free State shall no longer extend to Northern Ireland." The Irish Free State was a constitutional monarchy sharing a monarch with the United Kingdom and other Dominions of the British Commonwealth. The country had a governor-general , a bicameral parliament, a cabinet called the "Executive Council", and a prime minister called the President of the Executive Council. Over how many months did the Irtish delegates negotiate the Anglo-Irish Treaty in London? Answer: The question asks the duration of the treaty negotiation in months. The passage states that the negotiation took place "from 11 October to 6 December 1921". From October 11th to November 11th is one month. From November 11th to December 6th is less than one month but close enough to almost a month. Adding these two values together, 1 month + ~1 month = ~2 months. So the answer is $\boxed{2}$.
Overall Quality: poor
The reasoning correctly identifies the start and end dates but performs an incorrect calculation of the duration in months, leading to an inaccurate estimate of '2 months' when the actual duration is less than two months.

Statement
From October 11th to November 11th is one month. From November 11th to December 6th is less than one month but close enough to almost a month. Adding these two values together, 1 month + ~1 month = ~2 months.
Explanation
The negotiation spanned from October 11 to December 6. This is 56 days, which is less than two full months (October 11 to December 11 would be two months). The reasoning incorrectly calculates the duration, leading to an answer of 2 months when the actual duration is less than two months (it is 1 month and 25 days, or approximately 1.8 months). Question #history_1313_797e963c-52f2-4f8e-ba70-5a382cda0d85
Though there had been popular support for the war among the Russian public following the Japanese attack at Port Arthur in 1904, that popular support soon turned to discontent after suffering multiple...
Clean
Full Question
Though there had been popular support for the war among the Russian public following the Japanese attack at Port Arthur in 1904, that popular support soon turned to discontent after suffering multiple defeats at the hands of the Japanese forces. For many Russians, the immediate shock of unexpected humiliation at the hands of Japan caused the conflict to be viewed as a metaphor for the shortcomings of the Romanov autocracy. Popular discontent in Russia after the war added more fuel to the already simmering Russian Revolution of 1905, an event Nicholas II had hoped to avoid entirely by taking intransigent negotiating stances prior to coming to the table. Twelve years later, that discontent boiled over into the February Revolution of 1917. In Poland, which Russia partitioned in the late 18th century, and where Russian rule already caused two major uprisings, the population was so restless that an army of 250,000-300,000‚Äîlarger than the one facing the Japanese‚Äîhad to be stationed to put down the unrest. Some political leaders of the Polish insurrection movement sent emissaries to Japan to collaborate on sabotage and intelligence gathering within the Russian Empire and even plan a Japanese-aided uprising. In Russia, the defeat of 1905 led in the short term to a reform of the Russian military that allowed it to face Germany in World War I. However, the revolts at home following the war planted seeds that presaged the Russian Revolution of 1917. This was because Tsar Nicholas II issued the October Manifesto, which included only limited reforms such as the Duma and failed to address the societal problems of Russia at the time. How many revolutions did Russia suffer in the early 20th century?
Ground Truth Answer
[['3', 1]]
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: Though there had been popular support for the war among the Russian public following the Japanese attack at Port Arthur in 1904, that popular support soon turned to discontent after suffering multiple defeats at the hands of the Japanese forces. For many Russians, the immediate shock of unexpected humiliation at the hands of Japan caused the conflict to be viewed as a metaphor for the shortcomings of the Romanov autocracy. Popular discontent in Russia after the war added more fuel to the already simmering Russian Revolution of 1905, an event Nicholas II had hoped to avoid entirely by taking intransigent negotiating stances prior to coming to the table. Twelve years later, that discontent boiled over into the February Revolution of 1917. In Poland, which Russia partitioned in the late 18th century, and where Russian rule already caused two major uprisings, the population was so restless that an army of 250,000-300,000‚Äîlarger than the one facing the Japanese‚Äîhad to be stationed to put down the unrest. Some political leaders of the Polish insurrection movement sent emissaries to Japan to collaborate on sabotage and intelligence gathering within the Russian Empire and even plan a Japanese-aided uprising. In Russia, the defeat of 1905 led in the short term to a reform of the Russian military that allowed it to face Germany in World War I. However, the revolts at home following the war planted seeds that presaged the Russian Revolution of 1917. This was because Tsar Nicholas II issued the October Manifesto, which included only limited reforms such as the Duma and failed to address the societal problems of Russia at the time. How many revolutions did Russia suffer in the early 20th century? Answer: The passage mentions the Russian Revolution of 1905 and the February Revolution of 1917, and the Russian Revolution of 1917. While there are three mentions of revolutions, the February Revolution and the Russian Revolution of 1917 likely refer to the same event. Thus, there were two distinct revolutions: the 1905 revolution and the 1917 revolution. One + One = Two. So the answer is $\boxed{2}$.
Overall Quality: good
The reasoning correctly identifies the two distinct revolutions mentioned in the text (1905 and 1917) and arrives at the correct count based on the provided context.

‚úì No hallucinations detected

Question #history_1450_cf455cf1-0221-45c3-88ed-b0c768ed82c5

Clean
Full Question
The Guatemalan authorities were unaware of ongoing contacts between the colonial authorities in Yucat√°n and the Itza. In the second half of 1695 President Barrios began planning another expedition against the Itza from Verapaz, following harsh criticism of Juan D√≠az de Velasco's retreat from near Lake Pet√©n Itz√° in April of that year. Barrios died in November, and oidor Jos√© de Escals became acting head of the Guatemalan colonial administration. He appointed oidor Bartolom√© de Am√©squeta to lead the next expedition against the Itza. Am√©squeta marched his men through torrential rain from Cahab√≥n to Mop√°n, arriving on 25 February 1696; the Guatemalans were still unaware of the clashes between Garc√≠a's forces and the Itza. Am√©squeta's expedition was suffering from shortages of native labour and supplies. Twenty-five of his 150 men were sick, and his advance stalled as the force rested up at Mop√°n. Captain D√≠az de Velasco volunteered to lead a party of 25 men ahead to the lake; he was accompanied by Dominican friars Crist√≥bal de Prada and Jacinto de Vargas. He was also accompanied by AjK'ixaw, the Itza nobleman who had been taken prisoner on D√≠az's previous expedition, who served as a trusted guide, scout and translator. They set out from Mop√°n on 7 March and left some sick soldiers with some supplies after five days, they then caught up with an advance party of roadbuilders and their military escort at R√≠o Chakal. The two forces combined, giving D√≠az a force of 49 soldiers and 34 porters and archers from Verapaz. Once they arrived at IxB'ol, near the shore of Lake Pet√©n Itz√°, AjK'ixaw was sent ahead as an emissary to Nojpet√©n. How many different military forces combined did Diaz have?
Ground Truth Answer
[['2', 2]]
Generated Answer
Reformatted Question: The Guatemalan authorities were unaware of ongoing contacts between the colonial authorities in Yucat√°n and the Itza. In the second half of 1695 President Barrios began planning another expedition against the Itza from Verapaz, following harsh criticism of Juan D√≠az de Velasco's retreat from near Lake Pet√©n Itz√° in April of that year. Barrios died in November, and oidor Jos√© de Escals became acting head of the Guatemalan colonial administration. He appointed oidor Bartolom√© de Am√©squeta to lead the next expedition against the Itza. Am√©squeta marched his men through torrential rain from Cahab√≥n to Mop√°n, arriving on 25 February 1696; the Guatemalans were still unaware of the clashes between Garc√≠a's forces and the Itza. Am√©squeta's expedition was suffering from shortages of native labour and supplies. Twenty-five of his 150 men were sick, and his advance stalled as the force rested up at Mop√°n. Captain D√≠az de Velasco volunteered to lead a party of 25 men ahead to the lake; he was accompanied by Dominican friars Crist√≥bal de Prada and Jacinto de Vargas. He was also accompanied by AjK'ixaw, the Itza nobleman who had been taken prisoner on D√≠az's previous expedition, who served as a trusted guide, scout and translator. They set out from Mop√°n on 7 March and left some sick soldiers with some supplies after five days, they then caught up with an advance party of roadbuilders and their military escort at R√≠o Chakal. The two forces combined, giving D√≠az a force of 49 soldiers and 34 porters and archers from Verapaz. Once they arrived at IxB'ol, near the shore of Lake Pet√©n Itz√°, AjK'ixaw was sent ahead as an emissary to Nojpet√©n. How many different military forces combined did Diaz have? Answer: Diaz initially had a party of 25 men. Later, he caught up with another force at Rio Chakal. These two forces combined. Therefore, Diaz combined two different military forces. So the answer is $\boxed{2}$.
Overall Quality: good
The reasoning correctly identifies that Diaz's initial party combined with an advance party of roadbuilders and their escort, resulting in two forces combining to form his final group before reaching IxB'ol.
